definition: younger sister
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
younger sister

sentences.english: After school, I went to Maxine's classroom to ask her wether my wallet is at home.
sentences.chinese: 放學時，我到阿妹的班級問問她有沒有看見我的錢包。

sentences.english: The younger sister is the moon, melts the elder brother dreamland.
sentences.chinese: 阿妹是月亮，融進阿哥夢鄉。

sentences.english: Hold him by the nose, dearie, then he'll splutter and wake up.
sentences.chinese: 捏住他的鼻子，阿妹，他就會呼嚕呼嚕地醒過來。

sentences.english: The younger sister is the moon, hangs on the elder brother heart.
sentences.chinese: 阿妹就是月亮，掛在阿哥心上。

sentences.english: A-Mei is famous for her songs.
Many people went to the concert to see A-Mei sing.
sentences.chinese: 許多人去阿妹的演唱會看她的表演。

sentences.english: I like A-mei´s songs very much.
Q soon as a small-Mei, who you want to pick up.
sentences.chinese: 問一聲小阿妹，你要去接誰。

sentences.english: A-Mei's annual concert tickets were all sold out a month ago.
sentences.chinese: 阿妹的年度演唱會門票，一個月前就全賣光了啊。

definition: A-Mei, aka Gulilai Amit (1972-), aboriginal Taiwanese pop singer
love song
Sandy Lam (1966-), Hong Kong pop singer
to sing/to call loudly/to chant
little sister/girl/(Tw) young female employee working in a low-level role dealing with the public (assistant, waitress, attendant etc)
in duet/answering phrase/antiphonal answer
Joey Yung (1980-), Hong Kong pop singer and actress
Coco Lee (1975-), pop singer, songwriter and actress
grandma (paternal) (Tw)/(dialect) mother/nurse/amah/(Manchu) father

Stefanie Sun (1978-), Singaporean singer-songwriter
Alian District, a rural district in Kaohsiung, Taiwan
answering phrase of duet/to sing antiphonal answer
younger brother
